SEARCH
Package org.boardgames.crossway.model

Class History

java.lang.Object
org.boardgames.crossway.model.History
public final class History extends Object
A linear history implementation with undo and redo functionality.

This class maintains a complete move history using a two-stack approach: one for "past" moves and one for "future" moves. This design supports both undoing and redoing moves. When moves are undone, they are transferred from the pastMoves stack to the futureMoves stack. If a new move is committed after an undo operation, the futureMoves stack is cleared to ensure the history remains linear and does not branch.

Key features:

  • Linear move history with bidirectional navigation.
  • Automatic clearing of future moves when a new move is committed after an undo.
  • Serialization and deserialization support for JSON.

History state transitions:

 Initial state:
 pastMoves=[], futureMoves=[]

 After committing moves M1, M2, M3:
 pastMoves=[M1, M2, M3], futureMoves=[]

 After one undo operation:
 pastMoves=[M1, M2], futureMoves=[M3]

 After one redo operation:
 pastMoves=[M1, M2, M3], futureMoves=[]

 After one undo and then committing a new move M4:
 pastMoves=[M1, M2, M4], futureMoves=[] (M3 is discarded)

  • Constructor Details

    • History

      public History()
      Creates a new, empty history instance. Both the past and future move stacks are initialized as empty.

    • History

      public History(List<Move> pastMoves, List<Move> futureMoves)
      Creates a new history instance with specified past and future moves. This constructor is primarily used by the Jackson library for deserialization.
      Parameters:
      pastMoves - A list of moves representing the past history. Can be null.
      futureMoves - A list of moves representing the future history. Can be null.

  • Method Details

    • commit

      public void commit(Move move)
      Commits a new move to the history.

      The new move is added to the top of the pastMoves stack. If there are any moves in the futureMoves stack (due to a previous undo operation), they are cleared to ensure the history remains linear.

      Parameters:
      move - The move to add to the history. Must not be null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided move is null.

    • undo

      public Move undo()
      Undoes the most recent move in the history.

      The last move from the pastMoves stack is popped and pushed onto the futureMoves stack, making it available for a redo operation. If the pastMoves stack is empty, no action is taken.

      Returns:
      The undone Move, or null if there are no moves to undo.

    • redo

      public Move redo()
      Redoes the most recently undone move.

      The last move from the futureMoves stack is popped and pushed back onto the pastMoves stack. This effectively reapplies a move that was previously undone. If the futureMoves stack is empty, no action is taken.

      Returns:
      The redone Move, or null if there are no moves to redo.

    • swapColors

      public void swapColors()
      Swaps the color of all moves stored in this history.

    • getPastMoves

      public List<Move> getPastMoves()
      Returns a copy of the past moves.

      This method is used for serialization and to provide a read-only view of the moves that have been committed. The moves are returned in chronological order.

      Returns:
      A new List containing all past moves.

    • getFutureMoves

      public List<Move> getFutureMoves()
      Returns a copy of the future moves.

      This method is used for serialization and to provide a read-only view of the moves that have been undone and can be redone. The moves are returned in reverse chronological order of their undo.

      Returns:
      A new List containing all future moves.
